skill.name: white-label
skill.description: Complete WordPress white-labeling using FREE plugins only - ASE, Branda, White Label CMS, Admin Menu Editor. Covers login page branding, admin cleanup, security hardening, and client handoff preparation.
skill.summary: Complete WordPress white-labeling using FREE plugins only - ASE, Branda, White Label CMS, Admin Menu...
skill.author: CrazySwami

security_audit.summary: Legitimate WordPress white-labeling automation tool. Static scanner flagged documentation code examples as external commands, color hex codes as weak cryptographic algorithms, and standard WordPress API calls as system reconnaissance. All findings are false positives. The skill uses standard WP-CLI and Docker operations to configure legitimate WordPress plugins.

medium_findings.title: External logo download without validation
medium_findings.description: The script downloads logos from external URLs using download_url() for branding purposes. This is a legitimate feature but could download arbitrary files if config file is compromised.
medium_findings.mitigation: Uses WordPress download_url() which includes sanitization. Risk is limited to config file access.

content.value_statement: Manually configuring WordPress white-labeling plugins takes hours and is error-prone. This skill automates the entire process using free plugins, creating professional branded experiences in minutes.
actual_capabilities: Automates configuration of ASE, Branda, and White Label CMS plugins
Uploads and configures custom logos for login and admin areas
Sets custom login URLs for security hardening
Configures dashboard widgets, admin menus, and user permissions
Applies brand colors to login page and admin interface
Hides WordPress branding and replaces with client branding
limitations: Requires WordPress with WP-CLI access or Docker container
Only works with free plugins (ASE, Branda, White Label CMS)
Logo must be accessible via URL for download
Cannot modify plugin code or add premium features

best_practices: Test the configuration on a staging site before applying to production
Keep a backup of original WordPress settings before running automation
Use descriptive login URLs that clients can remember easily
anti_patterns: Do not use common login URLs like /login or /admin for security
Avoid uploading oversized logos that slow down the login page
Never hide essential admin menus that clients need for content management

faq.question: Which plugins does this skill configure?
faq.answer: It configures ASE, Branda, White Label CMS, and Admin Menu Editor - all free WordPress plugins.

faq.question: Can I use this with existing WordPress sites?
faq.answer: Yes, any WordPress site with WP-CLI access or Docker container works.

faq.question: What if I do not have a logo URL?
faq.answer: Skip logo configuration or upload to media library first, then use the attachment ID.

faq.question: Is it safe to change the login URL?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill uses ASE plugin to safely change login URLs while maintaining functionality.

faq.question: Can I undo the white-labeling changes?
faq.answer: Changes modify WordPress options which can be reverted manually or by deactivating plugins.

faq.question: Does this work with WordPress multisite?
faq.answer: Current implementation works best with single installations. Multisite may need per-site configuration.
